name: phptools-vscode
description: All-in-One PHP support - IntelliSense, Debug, Formatter, Code Lenses, Code Fixes, Linting, Refactoring, PHPUnit Tests, Web Server, and more.

php.completion.parameters.markdownDescription: Automatically insert parentheses `()` after completion of functions, and trigger parameter hints.
markdownEnumDescriptions: Do not insert parentheses and do not trigger parameters completion.
Insert parentheses `()` after the function completion and place cursor inside them.

php.completion.docblock.markdownDescription: Generate DocBlock comment automatically by typing `/**` above a declaration.

php.completion.showNamespaceLabel.markdownDescription: Show item namespace in the completion list.

php.completion.showParameters.markdownDescription: Show function signature in the completion list.

php.completion.showDeprecated.markdownDescription: Customize deprecated symbols in the completion list.

php.completion.autoimport.markdownDescription: Completion of types, functions, and constants outside of the current namespace scope.
markdownEnumDescriptions: Fully qualifies the name upon completion.
Inserts the name as it is, without importing the alias.
Do not show inaccessible symbols in code completion.

php.completion.autoimport-docblock.markdownDescription: Completion of type names outside of the current namespace scope, when completing inside a PHP doc block (e.g. in `@param` tag).
markdownEnumDescriptions: Fully qualifies the name upon completion.
Inserts the name as it is, without importing the alias.
Do not show inaccessible types in code completion.

php.completion.namingConvention.markdownDescription: Naming convention for generated member names.

php.completion.getterSnippet.markdownDescription:
Code to be placed inside the getter function. This is inserted using code action over a private class properties to generate `getter` function.

By default it's similar to:

```php
return {PROPERTY};
```
Use variables:
- `{PROPERTY}` (`$this->property` or `self::property`)
- `{THIS}` (`$this` or ``)
- `{NAME}` (the property name without `$`).

php.completion.setterSnippet.markdownDescription:
Code to be placed inside the setter function. This is inserted using code action over a private class properties to generate `setter` function.

By default it's similar to:

```php
{PROPERTY} = ${NAME};
return {THIS};
```
Use variables:
- `{PROPERTY}` (`$this->property` or `self::property`)
- `{THIS}` (`$this` or ``)
- `{NAME}` (the property name without `$`).

php.docblock.packageSnippet.markdownDescription:
DocBlock snippet at file beginning. Example:
```json
"php.docblock.packageSnippet": {
  "@author": "${name:John}",
  "@copyright": "(c) $CURRENT_YEAR"
}
```

php.docblock.functionSnippet.markdownDescription:
DocBlock snippet above a function. Example:
```json
"php.docblock.functionSnippet": {
  "@author": "${name:John}",
  "@throws": false
}
```

php.docblock.getterSetterSnippet.markdownDescription: Snippet for DocBlocks generated using getter/setter code action

php.hover.parameters.markdownDescription: Show function parameters description in the mouse hover tool-tip.

php.hover.parametersFullName.markdownDescription: Show fully qualified parameter type name in function tool-tip.

php.hover.documentation.markdownDescription: If available, show symbol documentation link in the mouse hover tool-tip.

php.hover.fullname.markdownDescription: Show full name of symbols, including the full class name.

php.hover.containingClass.markdownDescription: Show containing class name of class members.

php.linkedEditing.variables.markdownDescription: When `#editor.linkedEditing#` setting is enabled, this option specifies whether to apply linked edits to local variable names.

php.workspace.includePath.description: Paths containing additional PHP declarations. Separated with semi-colon.

php.workspace.shortOpenTag.markdownDescription: Enable or disable parsing inside `<?` tag. Default value is `"auto"` so short open tags will be _enabled_ if there is no `<?xml` tag.

php.executables.markdownDescription:
Defines PHP profiles as a user defined name and a `php` binary path.
Example: `"php.executables": { "v7.4": "/usr/bin/php7.4" }`

php.version.markdownDescription: A PHP version or a profile name defined in `#php.executables#`.

php.codeLens.enabled.description: Enable/disable code lenses in PHP files.

php.problems.scope.markdownDescription:
What workspace folders get analyzed for problems.

Default is `"opened"` which gets problems for opened documents only.

_Note, **fatal errors** and **parse errors** are always reported across the entire workspace._

php.problems.exclude.markdownDescription:
Path patterns to be ignored from reporting problems. Value can be set to `true` to ignore all problems or a comma separated list of specific problem codes.

_See [Problems Configuration](https://docs.devsense.com/vscode/problems#phpproblemsexclude) for more details._


_Example:_
```json
"php.problems.exclude": {
  "/": [406],
  "vendor/": true,
}
```

php.problems.excludeGitIgnore.markdownDescription: Do not report problems in files specified in `.gitignore` file.

php.problems.workspaceAnalysis.description: Deprecated. Enable full workspace-wide analysis. Enabled by default.

php.cache.enableOnlineCache.markdownDescription:
For better performance, IntelliSense for _composer_ packages may be fetched from a cache server.

This improves workspace indexing after installing or updating composer packages.

php.cache.location.markdownDescription: Full path for local IntelliSense cache for _composer_ packages.

php.stubs.markdownDescription:
Array of extension names to be included in the built-in IntelliSense, the localized manual, and code analysis. By default all the standard PHP extensions are included.

Examples:

```json
{
  "php.stubs": ["*", "com", "pcntl", "xdebug"]
}
```

List of possible values:

- `"*"` includes the standard set of extensions.
- `"all"` includes all the available extensions.
- `com`
- `pcntl`
- `zip`
- `zlib`
- ...

php.debug.port.markdownDescription: Default Xdebug port or array of ports. This value is used when `port` is not specified in `launch.json` settings. Usually 9000 or 9003.

phpTools.license.markdownDeprecationMessage: This setting has been deprecated, you may delete it. Use _Command Palette_, the command `PHP Tools: Activate License`.

phpTools.suppressPremiumFeatures.markdownDescription: Most of the premium features will be disabled and user won't be bothered with related messages or blocked code actions.

php.highlight-todo.enable.markdownDescription: Enable highligting of to-do comments (`@todo`, `// TODO`, or `# TODO`). Enabled by default.

php.highlight-todo.style.markdownDescription: The style of to-do decoration. See [ThemableDecorationRenderOptions](https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/vscode-api#ThemableDecorationRenderOptions) for details.

phpunit.phpunit.description:
PHPUnit binary to be used to run and debug the tests. It can be either full path or path relative to the workspace root.

Example: `./vendor/bin/phpunit` or `"phpunit"`.

phpunit.enableAutomaticRefresh.markdownDescription: Watch for `.php` and `phpunit` changes and refresh tests view automatically. Enabled by default.

phpunit.preTask.markdownDescription: Task or array of tasks defined in `tasks.json` to be executed before a test execution is finished. Task attributes will get updated with `"filter"` or `"testsuite"` values.

phpunit.postTask.markdownDescription: Task or array of tasks defined in `tasks.json` to be executed after a test execution is finished. Task attributes will get updated with `"filter"` or `"testsuite"` values.

commands.title: Start Debugging and Stop on Entry

externalConsole.description: Launch debug target in external console.

args.description: Command line arguments passed to the program.

cwd.description: Absolute path to the working directory of the program being debugged. Default is the current workspace.

envfile.markdownDescription: Path to `.env` file. Environment variables will be merged into the process environment variables.

phpVersion.markdownDescription: PHP version or profile name defined in `#php.executables#`

runtimeExecutable.description: Absolute path to the runtime executable to be used. Default is the runtime executable on the PATH.

runtimeArgs.description: Optional arguments passed to the runtime executable.

env.description: Environment variables passed to the program.

port.description: Port on which to listen for Xdebug

serverSourceRoot.description: Deprecated: The source root when debugging a remote host
serverSourceRoot.deprecationMessage: Property serverSourceRoot is deprecated, please use pathMappings to define a server root.

localSourceRoot.description: Deprecated: The source root on this machine that is the equivalent to the serverSourceRoot on the server.
localSourceRoot.deprecationMessage: Property localSourceRoot is deprecated, please use pathMappings to define a local root.

pathMappings.description: A mapping of server paths to local paths.

exclude.description: Glob patterns that the debugger won't debug.

ignoreExceptions.description: Exception class names or patterns that should be ignored, supporting '*' and '**' wildcards.

log.description: If true, will log all communication between VS Code and the adapter

noDebug.description: If true, starts the process without debugging. False by default ('debug' mode enabled).

trigger.description: If set, only requests with `XDEBUG_TRIGGER` GET/POST/COOKIE or ENV variable equal to this value, will be debugged. By default, every request is being debugged. Example: "trigger": "Start", so only requests to http://localhost?XDEBUG_TRIGGER=Start will initiate debugging.

profile.description: If true, enables Xdebug 'profile' mode. Disabled by default.

openProfile.description: Override profile output dir and open the profiling result after the debug sessions stops.

enable.description: If True, will connect to DBGp proxy configured in this section

host.description: The host address where the proxy is located. It's usually same as web server, but it's doesn't have to be.

port.description: The port where the proxy server is listening.

ideKey.description: The Xdebug IDE Key used to register the VS CODE. If not set, the current user name is used instead.

maxConnections.description: Maximum number of simultaneous debug sessions.

configurationSnippets.label: PHP: Launch built-in server
configurationSnippets.description: Launches PHP's built-in development server and starts debugging.

configurationSnippets.label: PHP: Launch & Profile built-in server
configurationSnippets.description: Launches PHP's built-in development server and starts profiling requests.

configurationSnippets.label: PHP: Launch current script in console
configurationSnippets.description: Launches currently opened PHP document as a console application.

configurationSnippets.label: PHP: Listen for Xdebug
configurationSnippets.description: Starts debugging by waiting for an incoming Xdebug connection from a remote server.

file.description: Path to the .php file to be executed.

phpVersion.description: PHP version or profile name defined in 'php.executables'

badges.description: PHP Tools for VS Code Changelog

scripts.precompile: npm run -S generate-resource && npm run -S generate-formatsettings
scripts.vscode:prepublish: npm run -S precompile && pwsh ./scripts/prepublish.ps1 && npm run -S esbuild-base -- --minify && npm run -S esbuild-uninstall -- --minify && npm run -S postbuild
scripts.compile: dotnet publish ../Devsense.PHP.LanguageServer --ignore-failed-sources --output out/server && npm run -S esbuild-base -- --sourcemap && npm run -S esbuild-uninstall && npm run -S postbuild
scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run -S build-tests
